note.p: Burial: Bruce family chapel, Culross, Fife, Scotland, Europe (c. July 1680)
Education: St Leonard's College, St Andrews (matriculated 1645)

Career: Left Scotland and moved to Bremen (1657), Hamburg (1658) and The Hague (1660); collaborated with Hugen de Zulinchem and Christiaan Huygens to devise a pendulum clock to determine longitude at sea (1658); returned to Scotland (1660); Privy Councillor (Scotland) (1660); Major in the Holland Regiment (1665); Commander at Pentland rising (1666); Extraordinary Lord of Session (1667-1680); joint Commissioner of the Treasury (Scotland) (1666-1680); Privy Councillor (England) (1674-1676)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; GEC; Dalton; ODNB
References: D C Martin, 'Sir Robert Moray, FRS (1608?-1673)' in NR 1960 vol 15 pp 239-250
A J Youngson, 'Alexander Bruce, FRS, Second Earl of Kincardine (1629-1681)' in NR 1960 vol 15 pp 251-258, plate
C Wemyss 'Merchant and Citizen of Rotterdam: The Early Career of Sir William Bruce' in Architectural Heritage XVI, 2005, pp14-30
